tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“The similarities between humans and computers are more numerous than the differences”

-P.A.Scott

Do you want to know how computers make decisions like a human? Are you interested in learning how the world's smartest computer, IBM Watson, works? Then look no further!

In this edition of Kurukshetra, we introduce you to a whole new era in computing known as Cognitive Computing. In this age, the volume of unstructured information is growing at an alarming rate. We need advanced technologies to make sense of this overwhelming amount of data and make better decisions. Cognitive computing is one such technology. Cognitive computing systems extend human intelligence and combine it with the computational power of a computer to create a whole new kind of supercomputers, one that can understand natural language, make smart decisions and produce intelligent solutions. So come join us and learn the future of computing.

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1:(19/02/2016, Friday)

Session 1 (9 AM - 10:30 AM)

    » Introduction to Cognitive Computing technologies

          This session will provide an overview of the cognitive computing technologies including Natural Language process and Machine Learning.

 

Session 2 (11 AM – 12 PM)

    » How IBM Watson works

          High level overview of IBM Watson technology and how it provides insights from unstructured data.

 

Session 3 (1 PM - 2:30 PM)

    » Watson in Bluemix

          Overview of IBM Bluemix and Cognitive services in IBM Bluemix. It would include live demo of couple of cognitive services

 

Session 4 (3 PM - 4:30 PM)

    » Getting Ready:

          Demo and preparation for Hands-on implementation

          Demo of some interesting cognitive applications, refresh of node.js concepts and preparation for hands-on implementation in Day 2.

 

Day 2: (20/02/2016, Saturday)

Session 1 (9 AM - 4 PM)

    Hands-on lab sessions on building your Watson powered cognitive application.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Eligibility Criterion:

Students having valid IDs from any recognised educational institution can attend this workshop.

» Pre-requisites:

Knowledge of programming and JavaScript will be very helpful.

» Type of Participation:

Participants have to register individually for this workshop.      

» Payment:

Registration fee for the workshop is INR 1000/-  per head. Participants will be redirected to payment page as soon as they register.
The payment details will also be intimated to the participants through mail.

» Certificate Criterion:

The certificate will be issued to the participant only if he/she attends all the sessions of the workshop. On failing to do so, the registration of the participant will stand for the cancellation and he/she will have to forfeit       the fee.

tabs.title: FAQ
tabs.content:
» Do I need previous experience in this field?

A basic knowledge of programming and JavaScript will be helpful.

» What do I gain from this workshop?

Through this workshop, you get a chance to learn all about cognitive computing which is cited to be the next big thing in the world of computing. You will learn how computers can be made to think, analyze and make intelligent decisions, just like human beings.

» Is this workshop theoretical?

Absolutely no! It will be interactive.

» Will I be provided with a certificate?

Yes, but we request you to participate for your own benefit and not for a certificate.

» Should I bring any material for this workshop?

You must bring a fully charged laptop and your College ID card. If you are required to bring anything else, we would inform you through mail after your registration.

» Do you provide accommodation?

Yes. The short listed candidates will be provided accommodation based on the availability and nativity. Participants have to separately register and pay for the accommodation. Participants will be notified of the registrations for accommodation.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“Creativity is intelligence having fun”

– Albert Einstein

Ever thought why a computer program should always be functional? Wondered how amazing it would be if we can bring out and showcase our creativity through coding? If yes, then this is the platform for you.

Here is an ultimate opportunity to all those prodigal brains with creative prowess. Draw wings to your ideas and make them flutter and fly in the horizon of Creative Coding. Not limited to just computer geeks and hardcore programmers, this workshop is meant for all those untiringly creative minds with unimaginable ideas, ranging from a musician or an architect, to a mechanic or an artist.

tabs.title: Guest Profile
tabs.content:
Gene Kogan:

Gene Kogan is an avant-garde programmer and a creative artist, who vouches for creative solution through code. The application of emerging technology into artistic and expressive contexts is his primary forte. He is a contributor to openFrameworks, Processing and p5.js and an Adjunct professor at Bennington College, Vermont, USA and an artist in residence at Eyebeam. His own artistic output is a characterised by inquiries into the grey areas of computational intelligence, and the application of machine learning to control generative and parametric systems.

Some of his talks and presentations include ‘Carnival of e-Creativity’ in Uttarakhand, ‘Generative systems’ for design at Microsoft Research Centre, Bangalore, ‘Code as Expression Communication and Collaboration’ in Brooklyn, New York, et al. Apart from generative arts, he has done several projects, of which Robot Shakespeare- an automatic bot that tweets modern versions of Shakespeare himself, Listening to the Ocean – a technique that uses algorithms to create various types of seashells by gypsum powder are a few to mention.

Profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gene-kogan-8234b51

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
Have you ever thought of what gives immunity to power systems? Imagine relaying as vaccines and over current as microbes. The role of vaccine is played by a unique type of relays called protection relays (Distance protection Relays specifically), which protects from harmful microbes (over currents).

A distance relay has the ability to detect a fault within a pre-set distance along a transmission line or power cable from its location.

This workshop will enlighten the Alstom's way of handling, relaying and their unique strategies in substation development.

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1 (17/02/2016, Wednesday)

Session 1

» Introduction:

» Basic Principle of Relaying

» Use of protection relays

» Their role in substation protection

» Some key features about automation

» Modernisation of substation.

Session 2: Distance Protection Relays

» Principle of distance protection relays

» Working of distance protection relays

Day 2 (18/02/2016, Thursday)

Session 1: Substation & Automation

» Modern techniques implemented in substations

» How do Engineers automate and manage substations will be described.

Session 2: Hands on

» Practical and interactive session on distance protection relays and automation of substations.

tabs.title: FAQ
tabs.content:
» What do I gain from this workshop?

» Fundamental theory behind relaying will be introduced.

» The problem of combining fast fault clearance with selective tripping of plant is a key aim for the protection of power systems, which will be the focus.

» Detection of fault within a pre-set distance along a transmission line will be dealt.

» Alstom's unique strategies and creative techniques in automation of substation will be highlighted.

» Modernisation techniques implemented in substation will be dealt.

» Do I require any special skill-set to attend the workshop?

Yes, you need to be a student of electrical domain. 

» Will this workshop be theoretical?

Absolutely not, you will be having hands on sessions as well.

» Will I be provided with a certificate?

Yes, but we request you to participate for your own benefit and not for a certificate.

» Should I bring any material for this workshop?

You must bring your College ID card. If you are required to bring anything else, we would inform you through mail after your registration.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“Man, alone, has the power to transform his thoughts into physical reality”- Napoleon Hill

Any idea is only said to be at its best when it can be given a physical embodiment. Ever considered converting a CAD file into an actual object?

From toys to prototypes to engine parts, to prostheses, to burgers, 3D printers can print almost anything and everything! Excited to learn more? Well, here is your chance!

The 10th edition of Kurukshetra brings to you the 3D printing workshop. This workshop will help each participant to learn various concepts related to 3D printing, from mechanical assembling 3D printers, designing and 3D modelling concepts, to printing objects using these assembled printers. We aim to provide an experience like never before!

Exciting opportunities awaiting the best of participants! Do make your presence at k! 2016 to become an expert in this emerging domain of 3D Printing technology- the culmination of human brilliance!

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1: (17/02/2016, Wednesday)

Session 1

» Introduction to 3D printing

» Printing technologies and concepts

» FDM / FFF 3D printer technology

» Electronics and Control System (Hands-on)

Session 2

» Stepper motor and Drives (hands on)

» Mechanical Assembly - frame - stability - motion - vibration (hands-on )

» Dynamics and Positioning using Core XY mechanism (hands on)

Session 3

» Assembly line concept (hands-on)

» Application of Kanban technique for assembly line (hands on)

» Quality control (hands on)

 

Day 2: (18/02/2016, Thursday)

Session 1

» Brahma3 - Story and technology of indigenous 3D printers from India

» Getting assembled printers to function

Session 2

» Design and 3D modelling concepts

» Printing objects on Brahma3 printers

» Fine tuning and enhancements

Session 3

» Design and product challenge

» Review                              

» Career counselling

» Internship selection

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do.”-Steve Jobs

Thanks to such people, now you can book a cab, book an appointment with your nearest doctor, order groceries to cook or order the food if you are too hungry to cook and no doubt that your smartphone today would have at least one or more of the apps for these services.

Have you ever thought that how on earth just one click on your favorite app could fetch you your requirements at your doorstep or have you ever been perplexed how your mobile phones act smart by providing you with proximity information? You can know all that from this workshop. Technology has surpassed human life so much that today we don’t use technology but we live technology and the reality is that it’s just the beginning.

We are here to carry you with us to the world of location based services, to make you understand what goes on at the back when you use these apps and providing you a real time hands on session on GPS data acquisition and dynamic analysis of the data using GIS.

Are you thinking twice because you have no idea about these concepts? Never mind, all you need is a basic knowledge in civil engineering and computer software, a driving passion and patience to learn things with your own tinge of creativity.

tabs.title: Guest Profile
tabs.content:
Mr.Krishna Rao T.V.B

Mr.Krishna Rao T.V.B is the Head of Technical Services Division, ESRI India, which is India's leading Geographic Information System (GIS) software and solutions provider. He has more than 16 years of experience in GIS, Utilities, Urban GIS, Digital Image processing, Natural Resource Management, Integration of Remote Sensing, GIS & Photogrammetry and is widely recognized for his lectures in the trade shows, conferences, seminars and workshops across India and abroad (UAE, Maldives, US, SriLanka). He has conducted more than 125 training sessions in the ISRO, SAC,SOI, NESAC, IIPA, National Center for Sustainable Coastal Zone Management and other institutes of high repute. He is a recognized Intergraph Certified Trainer and also well versed with Geospatial software like ArcGIS, GeoMedia, Image Analyst, ENVI, ERDAS, E-Cognition, ImageStation etc.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
The Apollo 11 VR Experience gives you the experience of the entire moon landing through Armstrong’s eyes. Pretty cool, huh?

Love to travel through the galaxy like in Interstellar? Or maybe peek inside a nuclear reactor? Or, if you want to relive Sachin's 100th ton or the Germany's winning goal? The new VR can do it all and gift you a truly surreal adventure.

It's not just about transporting you to places and time that you otherwise might not or cannot visit. Virtual Reality desires to present a feast for your senses, to enable you to do as you like in a seamless, flawless simulation of a world. The applications of VR are innumerable, be it in education, healthcare or tourism. But VR at home hasn't really taken off, implying that VR is still in the developing phase. The other side of Virtual Reality is creating the experience– this includes recording the material, capturing and making the models. So developing VR can be much more interesting than the application itself. Despite the complexities involved, k! provides a great platform to develop the beginning of amazing experience.

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1: (18/02/2016, Thursday)

 

Session 1

Basics of AR-VR

»Introduction to VR

»Intro to AR and difference from VR

»Techniques involved in VR

»VR eco-system and Use Cases

»Demo of GearVR and Oculus apps

 

Session 2

»Human Machine Interaction (HMI)

 

Session 3

»VR Programming

»Introduction to Oculus Mobile SDK

»Introduction to GVRf SDK

»Hands on with GVRf SDK
